abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Kyrgyz Urban Transport
            Project were as follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, and the Bank and borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. Lessons learned from the
            project are as follows: It is important to be flexible and
            to adjust a project design in response to changing
            conditions on the ground, even if it means making
            substantial changes late in the preparation process (or for
            that matter after a project is formally approved.) It is
            necessary to carefully consider the trade offs between
            ensuring successful physical implementation of a project
            through reliance on foreign expertise and the desire to
            achieve significant capacity building of local institutions
            (both public and private) over the medium term. It is
            important to conduct a careful assessment of the capability
            of the private sector to assimilate these public sector
            assets taking into account current market conditions. It is
            important to design pavement overlays somewhat thicker to
            avoid rapid deterioration of the pavement surface prior to
            the next likely maintenance cycle, in countries where
            regular road maintenance activities remain uncertain.
